translated: As It Was Said🔽The Collection on Three Things🔽Third

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:
“Monks, there are these three properties of escape.

original: Kāmānametaṁ nissaraṇaṁ yadidaṁ nekkhammaṁ, rūpānametaṁ nissaraṇaṁ yadidaṁ āruppaṁ, yaṁ kho pana kiñci bhūtaṁ saṅkhataṁ paṭiccasamuppannaṁ nirodho tassa nissaraṇaṁ—
analyzed: kāmānam etam nissaraṇam yat idam nekkhamma rūpānam etam nissaraṇam yat idam āruppa yam kho pana kiñci bhūtam saṅkhatam paṭiccasamuppannam nirodho tassa nissaraṇa
translated: The escape from sensual pleasures is renunciation, the escape from form is the formless, and the escape from whatever is fabricated, created, made, & conditioned is unbinding.

original: imā kho, bhikkhave, tisso nissaraṇiyā dhātuyo”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave tissaḥ nissaraṇiyāḥ dhātuyaḥ ti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: These are the three properties of escape.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
and the transcending of form,🔽having touched with his body the stilling of all fabrications,
the ardent one, at all times,
is a monk who sees rightly,
in that he is released right there.

original: sa ve yogātigo munī”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: sa veḥ yoga atigaḥ muni iti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: he is a sage who has gone beyond bonds.”
This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said. So it was with reference to this that it was said by the Blessed One: “There are three properties of escape.”
